alert.note: Alert for Carter (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 5:10PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: .A line of slow moving thunderstorms have already produced an estimated 1 to 2.5 inches of rain across western Carter County. These storms will persist, with more on the way that would bring additional rain to nearly saturated soils, resulting in rapid minor flooding. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Montana, including the following county, Carter. * WHEN...Until 915 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 508 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ekalaka, Ridgeway, Belltower, Hammond, Boyes, Medicine Rocks State Park and Ridge. - Tributaries leading into the Powder River and Boxelder Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
